p: In particular, the obtained results of antifungal activity and CMP assays are in agreement with Liu et al. [ 24] who studied the effect of solidago EO on the hyphal morphology and cell ultrastructure of B. cinerea by using the method described by Yu et al. [ 33]. The hyphae of B. cinerea became more shrunken and thinner after treatment with S. canadensis EO and its cell wall structure was damaged, hence the exosmosis increased as it was scanned by electron and transmission electron microscope [ 24]. This mechanism is highly related to our hypothesis of the biological mode of action of S. canadensis EO, which is due to cell wall damage of the fungus and increasing the CMP, ending with complete fungal death.
